result.execSummary:
The defendant Vanessa M Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: with credit for 46 days time served; Huber privileges for work, child care and treatment.

01-20-16/ Judge Tom R Wolfgram
The Court ordered the JOC amended to state that the term of Probation is commuted to one year.

miscConds.notes:
Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge;  payments to commence in July 8, 2016 at the rate of $25.00 per month or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Court will waive all costs and surcharges that can be waived due to the defendant's inability to pay.  Court ordered restitution set at $0.00.

Participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
Establish paternity.
AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Reflects 01-20-16 Court order commuting Probation term to 1 year.
Assessment due dates have been amended to reflect shorter payment term as well.

Commuting Probation Term signed, filed and distributed.
  Pursuant to the Department of Corrections' letter dated January 14, 2016, and section 973.09(2)(a)1m., Stats., the probation term is commuted to one year.  The judgment of conviction shall be amended accordingly.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Reserve Branch 21, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify probation term.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Vanessa M Garcia not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court waives the appearance of the defendant for this hearing only.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reyna Morales on behalf of attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Vanessa M Garcia not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjourned Pretrial Conference. Courr grants defense request.  Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse. Case adjourned to branch 21.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant reminded to have no contact with Nicholas N., David L., Adam T. and Sears located at 5300 South 76th Street, Greendale, WI.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.     No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Vanessa M Garcia in court with Student Intern Nicholas Conrardy under the supervision ofattorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Vanessa M Garcia in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Vanessa M Garcia
Current: 2701 South 10th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215   (Effective: 11-25-2015)
Prior: 729A South 22nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Steven R. Wiechmann in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Nicholas N., David L., Adam T. and Sears located at 5300 South 76th Street, Greendale, WI.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Vanessa M Garcia in court with attorney James D. Rael.  Defendant Vanessa M Garcia in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
